intro: Spilanthes nitida, commonly known as the slender bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and elongated, hairy stems. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Spilanthes nitida is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
